description.en: This macroeconomics course covers following topics: determination of aggregate demand and supply, GDP and GNI, economic growth and business cycles, intertemporal decisions of households and firms, functioning of the government sector, labour market and unemployment, monetary economics (money supply and demand, banking, exchange rates and prices, inflation), macroeconomic policies and output determination in a closed and open economy (IS-LM framework)
description.et: Makroökonoomika kursus annab ülevaate järgmistest teemadest: SKP kujunemine kogunõudluse ja kogupakkumise koosmõjul, majandusareng ja selle tsüklilisus, valitsuse (riigi) roll majanduse mõjutamisel, tööturu toimimise põhimõtted, kogunõudluse kujunemine kaheperioodilise mudeli raamistikus, rahaturu toimimise põhimõtted, inflatsioon ja selle mõjud, makromajandusliku tasakaalu kujunemine IS-LM mudeli raamistikus

objectives.en: To introduce to students modern macroeconomic concepts, in order to understand the operation mechanisms of  economy as whole
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele kaasaegseid makroökonoomika kontseptsioone  eesmärgiga mõista majanduse kui terviku toimimise mehhanisme.

description.et:
Three classroom tests. Tests cannot be retaken.
The first two tests have a weight of 35% from the final grade, the last (third) test has a weight of 30%.

grade_evaluation.et: The final grade is formed based on the results of three classroom tests. The first two tests have 35% weight each from the final grade, and the last (third) test has a weight of 30%. If a student fails to pass the course based on these three tests, then she/he has to take a resit exam (during an exam session) with weight 100% covering all the topics. The points from the classroom tests will not be considered to make up for any part of the resit exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
